description: This dashboard is designed to collect information about the Openshift logging framework which is based on Elasticsearch

panels.description:
0 => Green, cluster OK all primary and replicas shards present
1 => Yellow, Some replicas shards are missing, but all data is available
2 => Red, Some data is missing
Here, max is used in the expression because 3 data nodes have the same value
panels.title: Cluster status - $cluster

panels.description:
Contains the total value of the nodes in the cluster.
Max is used because 3 data nodes have the same value.
panels.title: Total number of nodes in the cluster - $cluster

panels.description: Contains the total value of data nodes in the cluster.
panels.title: Total number of data nodes in the cluster - $cluster

panels.description: total number of shards in the cluster according to the type
panels.title: Total number of shards in cluster ($cluster) according to type

panels.description: This is the total number of documents in the node. I think this includes the replica copies as well

targets.legendFormat: Total documents in all indices (including replicas)

panels.title: Total number of documents in different nodes of cluster: $cluster

panels.description: This is the total rate of document index operation that took place. It can be higher than the documents rate in the node.  The value is summed across all nodes
panels.title: Indexed operation rate for cluster: $cluster

targets.legendFormat: Avg time spent per node while searching queries
Avg time spent per node while indexing documents:
Avg time spent per node while search fetches

panels.description: the total number of shards including primary and replicas
panels.title: Number of shards per index in cluster - $cluster
Number of replicas per index in cluster - $cluster
Store size of the indices in bytes in nodes

panels.description: It is the same value like the store sizes, but it shows the growth rate of the storage
panels.title: Growth rate store size of the indices

panels.description: The rate of search query and time spent is derived from gauge values of total search query count increase and total time increase. Sum in the expression is kind of not very useful but makes the plot look nicer and gives a summed value for the whole cluster.
panels.title: Rate of search queries and time spent - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Search fetch and search execution are two different things. After search gets executed result need to get fetched for showing the results. Sum in the expression is kind of not very useful but makes the plot look nicer and gives a summed value for the whole cluster.

targets.legendFormat: rate of time spent in search fetches - {{$node}}

panels.title: Rate of search fetches and time spent - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Values are derived from gauge values. Sum in the expression is kind of not very useful but makes the plot look nicer and gives a summed value for the whole cluster.

targets.legendFormat: time spent in indexing documents of {{$node}}

panels.title: Rate of document indexing and time spent indexing - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: The rate of index flushes and time spent is derived from gauge values of total flush count increase and total time increase. Sum in the expression is kind of not very useful but makes the plot look nicer and gives a summed value for the whole cluster.
panels.title: Rate of index flushes and time spent - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: delete rate and time spent in deletes
panels.title: Rate of documents deleted and time spent - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: The rate of index merges and time spent is derived from gauge values of total merge count increase and total time increase. Sum in the expression is kind of not very useful but makes the plot look nicer and gives a summed value for the whole cluster.
panels.title: Rate of index merges and time spent - cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Please see the documentation of elasticsearch for details
panels.title: Other rates and time spent

panels.description:
More information can be found:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html
panels.title: OS CPU percent and process CPU percent for cluster: $cluster
Elastisearch OS load average for the cluster: $cluster

panels.description: More information can be found in: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html
panels.title: Total, used and free memory for the whole node: $cluster

panels.description: Further information can be found: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html

targets.legendFormat: memory used by ES process - node: {{node}}

panels.title: Virtual memory that is guaranteed to be available to cluster: $cluster

panels.description:
detail information can be found here:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html
panels.title: File descriptor related cluster: $cluster
Nodes stats: OS and Process information

panels.description: Detail information can be found: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html

targets.legendFormat: Total size (in bytes) of all file stores: {{node}}
Actual amount of free disk space the Elasticsearch node can utilise: {{mount}}, {{type}}, {{node}}

panels.title: File system related: $cluster

panels.description: Detail information can be found: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html
panels.title: IO operation related: $cluster

panels.description: Detail information can be found: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-nodes-stats.html
panels.title: IO read write rates in bytes $cluster
GC collections count rate and total time rate
Total number of rejected thread in cluster:$cluster

panels.description:
Definition of active and thread can be found here:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cat-thread-pool.html
panels.title: Threadpool: total vs active in node ($node) for cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Shows the tasks that are in the queue
panels.title: Number of tasks in the queue of threadpool of node ($node) for cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Circuit breakers used to prevent operations from causing an OutOfMemoryError.
panels.title: Circuit breaker sizes for cluster: $cluster

panels.description: Details can be found: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/circuit-breaker.html
panels.title: Circuit breakers stats for cluster: $cluster

targets.legendFormat: total query cache size on node: {{node}}

panels.title: Rate of http open connection - cluster: $cluster
Bytes received and bytes sent rate- cluster: $cluster
Packets received and packets sent rate - cluster: $cluster
Average time spent while generating metrics for cluster: $cluster

title: Topic: OpenShift Elasticsearch
